Regional, National, International or Fed: The system is voluntary, so national and international by active inclusion

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes (Banner, Datatel, PeopleSoft, CampusVue, Jenzabar, etc.)
Interoperability with External Systems: Yes (Google Scholar, Scopus, Web of Science, RefWorks, etc.)
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: Yes (EndNote, Mendeley, Zotero, tools which generate BiBTeX, CSV or XML files)

Research Networking Tool: PROFILES by Mentis (formerly Collaborative Partnership / Profile System)
Interoperability with External Systems: Yes (has API, works with Elsevier PURE, Activity Insight, VIVO etc.)

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes - Bi-directional and one way integrations with institution's enterprise systems available either through APIs or Kettle.
Interoperability with External Systems: Yes - Standard integrations with Web of Science, EndNote, Kopernio, InCites, EuroPMC, Research Professional, iThenticate, VIVO, Scopus and others. Individual integrations needed for specific institutions can also be configured via APIs or Kettle.

Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes National federated connectivity through DIRECT2Experts

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes institutions have access to Web Services in order to feed data into internal databases; Web Services can be consumed as directed by institution. Pure currently ingests a range of data from institutions' own systems, including grants data, HR data, institutional repositories, publication databases, book listings and more.
Interoperability with External Systems: Yes Scopus, PubMed, NIH RePORTER, Embase, Mendeley, arXiv, Worldcat, CrossRef, JournalTOC, CAB Abstracts, SAO/NSA Astrophysics Data System, Web of Science, institution's internal databases, including HR data, grants, publications, patents, etc.

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes (Institutions have access to the API with Scopus data in order to feed data into internal databases.)

Interoperability with External Systems: Yes ID resolver included, so links to external systems are created, like SSRN, ResearcherID, Google scholar alerts & Search, social mention search from personal page, MEEBO sharing possible, Tynt statistics included

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes Esploro provides multiple REST APIs for integration with enterprise systems such as HR Systems, CRIS / RIM, Institutional Repositories, profiles, grant management systems and more. Integration with repositories can be done also via OAI-PMH and Esploro automatically captures data, such as outputs, grants, researchers profiles and more from multiple institutional and cross- institutional systems.
Interoperability with External Systems: Yes Integration with the, ProQuestâ€˜s Summon Service, ORCID, PubMed, CrossRef, DataCite etc. Files can be imported and exported in formats like DublinCore, DataCite and BibTeX.
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes Plans to enable consortium and collaboration capabilities based on Ex Libris Alma Network and Community Zones

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Discontinued. Work on this system ceased; moved on to developing Digital Vita

Interoperability with External Systems: Yes Only other InfoEd modules (SMARTS: Service that automatically sends notices of funding opportunities via email. You provide keywords that describe your research interests, and SMARTS matches those keywords with present funding programs; SPIN: Enables subscribers to directly search for all sponsored programs, past and present, contained within the InfoEd database)
Yes PubMed; data is semantic web compliant as of August 2011

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes (Institutions have access to Web Services in order to feed data into internal databases.)

Research Networking Tool: INDURE (Indiana Database for University Research Expertise)

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes InfoEd, eIRB, Medical School faculty database
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes National federated connectivity through DIRECT2Experts

Interoperability with External Systems: Yes (PubMed, VIVO, Google Scholar, BibTex or CSV Sources)
Yes Only Clarivate Analytics Web of Science
Yes ORCID, university's repository, library catalogue. Files can be imported and exported as BibTeX.
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes Showroom works as a cross-instance search.

Interoperability with External Systems: Yes Pubmed, commercial sources of publication data, semantic web applications via VIVO ontology.
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes Profiles Users Group has regular conference calls and works on collaborative software development projects. Profiles can perform federated queries across other Profiles instances, and with other products using linked open data (VIVO ontology) and the DIRECT2Experts API.

Research Networking Tool: REACH NC Life Science Experts Visualization Tool

Interoperability with External Systems: Yes Through ResearcherID download service, institutions can load data into their internal systems. Also is integrated with other Clarivate Analytics offerings, including Web of Science, EndNote, and Research In View

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes (is possible through open data exchange standards)

Yes Clients have the ability to integrate with existing web profile management systems, export data for business intelligence solutions and easily submit research outcomes for various government assessment exercises. This includes HR, publications, teaching activities, grants, institutional repositories, and any other system providing or consuming research data.
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes Elements public profiling tool, Discovery Module, can be integrated with Direct2Expert.

Interoperability with Institutional Ente: Yes Data can be ingested from a wide variety of local sources (including HR, grants, course databases, institutional repositories, membership rosters, research interests, and many others) to reflect a complete view of the institution's priorities and efforts.
Integration with Add-on Components or Pr: Yes VIVO collaborates with eagle-I on research resources. Future plans include adding many additional data types which are meaningful in the academic research setting. VIVO data are structured using a comprehensive ontology designed for local extension and major ontology "plugins" such as BIBO and eagle-i.
Regional, National, International or Fed: Yes VIVO Consortium received $12.2M NIH ARRA U24 award in 2009 to fully develop software and create national system of federated research expertise directories/research networking systems; All other semantic web-compliant software platforms can be integrated into the consortium (example: Harvard Profiles). Participant in Direct2Experts and VIVO Search
The Canadian research funding councils as well as knowledge mobilization networks across the country (governments and universities) are working to develop a model to share what Yaffle has built
